The original text lacks clarity and conciseness due to run-on sentences and lack of structure.
- The original text is a single long sentence, making it hard to follow.
- Lack of clarity in conveying the purpose of the writing.

The polished version is clearer and more concise.
- The polished version breaks down the information into smaller, more digestible sentences.
- The purpose of the writing is clearly stated in the polished version.

3. Word Choice and Vocabulary:
Original: "i try to improve my ability to programming"

- Repetitive use of "to" and "my ability" makes the sentence awkward.
- Lack of specificity in the phrase "ability to programming."
